title: 103_hr1970
content: SCRAP TIRE TRUST FUND. Establishment of the Scrap Tire Trust Fund in the Treasury of the United States with two accounts - Scrap Tire Reduction Account and Scrap Tire Recycling Account. Appropriation of funds to the Scrap Tire Reduction Account, including 87 percent of amounts received during 1993. The Scrap Tire Reduction Account receives a percentage of fees from 1993 to 2004 for financial assistance to States for scrap tire management plans and reduction efforts. The Scrap Tire Recycling Account receives appropriations from fees imposed between 1993 and 2004 for scrap tire management and reduction efforts. The Scrap Tire Recycling Account receives appropriations from fees imposed between 1993 and 2004 for scrap tire management and reduction efforts. The Administrator imposes and collects a fee of $.85 on each new tire sold for financial assistance to States in managing scrap tires. The fee of $.85 per new tire sold between 1993 and 2004 is payable by the manufacturer or importer within sixty days. Imported articles with tires are treated as the importer of the tires, and the sale of the article is considered the sale of the tires. Amounts received from these fees are deposited into the General Fund of the Treasury. The paragraph exempts the sale of automobile bus chassis or body from certain regulations. Amounts appropriated are transferred monthly from the General Fund to the Trust Fund based on estimates. The Secretary of the Treasury can invest Trust Fund amounts not needed for withdrawals in interest-bearing US obligations. The Trust Fund can acquire obligations through original issue or purchase at market price. The Secretary can sell acquired obligations at market price, with interest and proceeds credited to the Trust Fund.
